column31:
Steps to reproduce;
 # Install a fresh Openfire.
 # Deploy the hazelcast clustering plugin.
 # Login to Openfire, navigate to the "Clustering" page. Select "Enabled", and click "Save Settings".

Expected results
 * The Clustering page indicates that clustering is enabled.

Actual results
 * The server stops responding. It is necessary to stop and restart Openfire, at which point the Clustering page indicates that clustering is enabled.

column31: Openfire 4.2.0 was installed from the zip file bundle. The Install4j openfire-service.exe failed with message "Windows could not start the openfire service on Local Computer". I had to copy the openfire-service.exe file from 4.1.6 to make it work.
column46:
11/28/17 06:08 PM;akrherz;Just for reference, the files did change, likely due to install4j updates, hmmm
{noformat}
$ unzip -l openfire_4_1_6.zip | grep '.exe'
    79904  02-22-2017 15:48   openfire/.install4j/i4jdel.exe
   248832  10-05-2017 15:06   openfire/bin/openfire-service.exe
   240640  10-05-2017 15:06   openfire/bin/openfire.exe
   240640  10-05-2017 15:06   openfire/bin/openfired.exe
$ unzip -l openfire_4_2_0_beta.zip | grep '.exe'
    91120  10-05-2017 14:35   openfire/.install4j/i4jdel.exe
   252928  11-17-2017 13:45   openfire/bin/openfire-service.exe
   246272  11-17-2017 13:45   openfire/bin/openfire.exe
   246272  11-17-2017 13:45   openfire/bin/openfired.exe
{noformat}

 # Enter a valid domain into the 'XMPP domain' field
 # Click 'Test'

Outcome: If the result isn't returned instantaneously, there is no indication on the page that anything is happening

Expected: Something, likely a spinner, is displayed to indicate that the software is currently doing something. Otherwise the user is likely to be confused and keep pressing 'Test' or just give up completely.

column31:
# Navigate to 'Server' > 'PubSub' > 'PubSub Service'
 # Enable 'Node Creation Restricted'
 # Add user to 'System Administrators' list
 # Make sure user *isn't* on 'Allowed to Create' list
 # As user, attempt to create a node

Outcome: User is able to create node

Expected: Either it is made clear to the administrating user that a sysadmin can still create nodes, despite not being on the 'Allowed to Create' list *OR* a user can't be made a sysadmin without already having been on the 'Allowed to Create' list.
